intro: Gomphocarpus semilunatus, commonly known as the moonflower or moon cactus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that open at night. The plant has a unique structure with a swollen, fleshy stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white with a distinctive, waxy appearance. The plant is also known for its ability to produce a milky sap, which can be toxic to some animals.
